result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Metz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Concurrent with: Case No. 15CF141.

Same conditions as Probation.
Concurrent with: Case No. 15CF141.

If the stayed portion of the sentence is imposed and there are outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall provide current financial information to the court.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
Attorney Fees To Be Determined.  Probation does NOT collect attorney fees.
If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain full-time employment.
Must seek work if unemployed or underemployed.
Must pay child support and arrears in full and on time through WI SCTF for all files pending in Barron County.

Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Must report any change of address and/or employment to the Child Support Agency within 48 hours.

timeConds.notes: Court orders 60 days jail. Jail may be served in Chippewa County if at no cost to Barron County. Must report to the Barron County jail on Saturday 2/25/17 at 8:00 AM.
